harm.label: Harm
harm.description: Choose to take 1 wound instead of 1 harm

contamination.label: Contamination
contamination.description: When all are marked raise Blood & clear Contamination

blood.label: Blood
blood.description: When Blood increases, take a blood advance

system.description: When you use the castle’s cast-offs to empower your bloodline’s actions, spend 1 Relic and get advantage on a roll.
When you claim a place of power as a forward base in the castle, roll +Swords.

partial.label: Partial success.
partial.value: It’s yours, and you can use it as a safe camp for the purposes of Rest and Relaxation and Travel the Labyrinth.

success.label: Success!
success.value:
It’s yours, and you can use it as a safe camp for the purposes of Rest and Relaxation and Travel the Labyrinth. Pick one bonus:

  • There’s room for more: it counts as another Bloodline’s camp too. Get 1-pact on them.
  • It’s well-located: explorers leaving the camp get +1 Travel the Labyrinth hold.
  • It’s comfortable and secure: get advantage on Rest and Relaxation here.

system.description: When you help another bloodline with a move, offer them a dice. If they take it, they roll it with their own as if they had advantage. If your dice is the highest, say how you made the difference and gain 1-Pact on them. If it's the lowest, the GM will say how helping them hurt you.
When you work a grand ritual, spend 1-3 Relics on occult resources and ceremonial paraphernalia and roll +Wands.

partial.label: Partial success.
partial.value:
The Regent weaves a counter-spell; you’ll need to defeat an Acolyte before anyone can work further rituals.

Choose one for each Relic spent:

system.choices:
• Reduce the Regent’s clock by 1.
  • Bless a weapon to strike true against one Acolyte, giving it the Holy perk.
  • Reduce a character’s Blood rating by one - they lose a Blood Advance.

system.description: When you provide aid to characters in a safe camp, roll +Chalices.
system.choices:
• Each explorer may heal all harm.
  • Each explorer may heal all wounds.
  • Each explorer can repair and resupply their weaponry.
  • Each explorer may form a new covenant, or raise an existing covenant by a step.
  • The regent’s clock doesn’t tick down.

system.description: Why let your sentiments hold you back when the castle will give you power in return for betrayal? Each covenant sets out a way the bond between you is weakened: whoever hits that trigger marks contamination, and the covenant’s rating is weakened by 1.

When you help or hinder another explorer, spend a point of covenant with them to give a dice to roll as per dis/advantage. If the dice you gave is the highest, get a point of covenant back; if it’s the lowest, gm will say what misfortune you suffer.

When you call on your covenants for help, distant (or dead) characters can answer. If they do, they step from the shadows near you as a wraith. They take action as normal, but can’t take wounds. The first harm they take weakens them; the second harm banishes them, weakening their covenant with you by 1.
When you draw on the power of a potent item or ritual site, roll +Sulphur.

partial.label: Partial success.
partial.value: Mark contamination and learn a spell - the GM says what it does. When you cast it, pick 1:

success.label: Success!
success.value:
Mark contamination and learn a spell - the GM says what it does. When you cast it, pick 1:

(you don’t need to pick an option on your first cast.)

system.description: When you assault a group of castle denizens, roll +Iron.

partial.label: Partial success.
partial.value:
You tear through them - say how. pick 2

  • They hit back - suffer harm.
  • You get some on you - mark contamination.
  • You end up in a risky position.
  • More are coming.

success.label: Success!
success.value: You tear through them - say how. pick 1

system.choices:
• They hit back - suffer harm.
  • You get some on you - mark contamination.
  • You end up in a risky position.
  • More are coming.

system.description: When you risk danger to change your environment or your position in it, roll +Mercury.

partial.label: Partial success.
partial.value:
pick one:

(the GM will give your action a cost: harm, contamination or lost gear.)

system.choices:
• You’re where you need to be.
  • Another explorer has a clear path to you.
  • A particular threat isn’t a problem any longer.

system.description: When you try to read a dangerous situation, roll +Glass

failure.label: Complications...
failure.value: You can ask the GM questions, ask 1 but prepare for the worst.

partial.label: Partial success.
partial.value: You can ask the GM questions, ask 1.

success.label: Success!
success.value: You can ask the GM questions, ask 3.

system.choices:
• Which exit takes me to my goal?
  • What here is valuable?
  • What can the enemies here do?
  • What should I be on the lookout for?

Get fleeting advantage when you act on each answer.

system.description: When you look for a safe space to recover, roll +Mercury.
system.choices:
• Tend to another explorer: they heal 2 Harm, or remove their lightest Wound.
  • Encourage another explorer - they get fleeting advantage.
  • Use your bloodline’s Shelter move.
  • Gain aid from a contact.

Each explorer checks over their covenant strengthen/betrayal triggers, and see if any have been hit since they last rested.

system.description:
When you attempt to navigate the labyrinthine twists of the castle, roll +Blood. If you choose, you may mark contamination to roll with advantage. On a hit, hold 1 and describe your insight into the ward’s purpose or layout.

 

When you leave the area, spend 1 hold to retreat to a safe camp, 2 to find an exit to another ward, and 3 to find the Acolyte’s sanctuary. One person rolls each time you navigate, and the group’s hold from multiple rolls is pooled together.

partial.label: Partial success.
partial.value: The area you arrive at contains castle denizens or traps.

success.label: Success!
success.value: The area you arrive at contains something valuable or useful.

system.description: When you confront danger head-on, roll +Iron.

partial.label: Partial success.
partial.value: You throw the foe off-balance and create an Opening, but take the brunt of their attack, pick 1:

success.label: Success!
success.value: You throw the foe off-balance and create an Opening, but take the brunt of their attack, pick 2:

system.choices:
• You roll with the blow: take 1 less harm.
• You are fearsome and commanding: the foe will focus only on you.
• Your mind is steel: you don’t mark contamination.

system.description: When you try to avoid incoming danger, roll +Mercury.
system.choices:
• You avoid taking harm.
  • You avoid getting separated from the others or losing something valuable.
  • The foe’s heedless in pursuit of you: create an Opening.

system.description: When you use an Opening to retreat, any and all characters can flee the battle. Advance the regent’s clock by one.
When you size up the enemy to locate a weak spot, roll +Glass.

partial.label: Partial success.
partial.value: you find an Opening. Say where it’s coming from - the environment, a chink in their armour, a flaw in their fighting style, pick 2.

success.label: Success!
success.value: you find an Opening. Say where it’s coming from - the environment, a chink in their armour, a flaw in their fighting style, pick 1.

system.choices:
• • The foe makes you its highest priority.
  • The Opening only lasts a few moments.
  • Attempts to use the Opening without one weapon perk have Disadvantage.

system.description: When you heal, encourage or aid an ally, roll +Sulphur.

success.label: Success!
success.value: Pick 1, the camaraderie shown gives your ally fleeting Advantage.

system.choices:
• They’re rescued from danger: a precipice, poison, a curse, etc.
  • They heal their lightest wound.
  • They heal 2 harm.

system.description:
When you take advantage of an Opening with...

  • Stealth and guile, roll +Mercury.
  • Physical force, roll +Iron.
  • Precise insight, roll +Glass.
  • Sorcery or sacrifice, roll +Sulphur.

partial.label: Partial success.
partial.value:
You damage one of the foe’s qualities - if you destroy its final quality, it’s dead. The Opening’s now gone. The GM picks 1:

  • The foe lashes out at you: take Harm appropriate to the enemy.
  • The foe separates you from the others or puts you in a spot.
  • The foe frenzies, dealing +1 Harm for the rest of the fight.

success.label: Success!
success.value: You damage one of the foe’s qualities - if you destroy its final quality, it’s dead. The Opening’s now gone.

system.description:
When the foe is defeated, everyone still living may raise Blood and add 1 to their Covenant with each other.
The foe’s sanctum becomes a place of power, usable for Forward Base.

As you die, you reveal a final pouch - one packed full of explosives. Pick one:

  • The explosion destroys one of your adversary’s Qualities.
  • The smoke gives your allies Advantage on Dodge and Rescue for the rest of the fight.
